text: I'm John le girl with the New York Times
out here in Queens where today a judge
acquitted all three detectives charged
in the shooting death of Sean Bell the
verdict was handed down by Judge Arthur
Jay Cooperman toward the case without a
jury judge Cooperman cited
inconsistencies in the testimony of the
prosecution witnesses he also cited the
fact that police should be given some
leeway in doing their jobs and in their
sin to use deadly physical force outside
the courtroom there was a cluster of
people they were very clearly upset by
the verdict it's a very highly charged
very emotional very racially charged
case even though two of the Texas
detectives who were charged and who were
on trial were black many of the people
in the community feel that's the cops
generally do not show the respect to

the Sean Bell case the issue mr. bell
and the two passengers that were with
him Joseph Guzman and Trent Benefield
both of them were also shot but they

that I think has fueled a lot of the

some protests and whatnot and um
